title: Ukrainian civilians train for war as invasion fears grow
description: Many civilians are not convinced Russia will invade, but say all the war talk is unsettling.

title: Under-pressure Johnson takes to world stage with Ukraine visit
description: The PM emphasises Western unity as he visits Ukraine amid fears of a Russian invasion.

title: First airing for news bulletin The Catch Up as BBC Three returns
description: BBC Three has returned as a fully-fledged TV channel, six years after it moved online.

title: Almost 500-mile-long lightning bolt crossed three US states
description: Experts said the bolt that stretched across Mississippi, Louisiana, and Texas was 'extraordinary'.

title: The myth of a 'super-charged' immune system
description: Suddenly we are all talking about immunity but how much do we really understand?

title: Tom Brady retires: Watch touchdown passes from his early play-off and Super Bowl wins
description: Watch a young Tom Brady's early post-season and Super Bowl touchdown passes, as the three-time NFL MVP announces his retirement at the age of 45.

title: How HIV elimination is within Australia's reach
description: Australian HIV cases have hit an all-time low - and it's partly a legacy of unconventional strategy.

title: UK weather: Why January 2022 was a record breaker
description: The start of the year has bucked trends and brought extreme conditions from warmth and sunshine to low rainfall, cloud and storms.

title: Covid-19: How many people have been infected more than once?
description: Reinfections have been rising sharply with Omicron, and they've now been added to official daily data.

title: Sue Gray: Boris Johnson focused on saving his own skin, says Keir Starmer
description: But deputy PM Dominic Raab says Boris Johnson has apologised and promised action to fix the running of No 10.

title: Stamps join the digital world with barcodes
description: People receiving mail will be able to watch videos and, in the future, greetings from senders.

title: Met Police: Watchdog slams misogyny and bullying within ranks
description: The police watchdog focused on behaviour by mostly PCs based at Charing Cross Police station.

title: Tesco puts 1,600 jobs at risk as it ends overnight restocking
description: The supermarket's plans will mean the end of overnight restocking at some of its stores.

title: 'Words can't describe how happy I am' - 16-year-old Heffernan joins AC Milan
description: Republic of Ireland defender Cathal Heffernan says "words can't describe" how happy he is at joining AC Milan on loan from Cork City.

title: All US federal prisons in lockdown after deadly gang fight
description: The rare nationwide lockdown of federal prisons comes after two inmates died in a fight in Texas.

title: House prices see fastest growth rate in January for 17 years
description: Prices last month were up 11.2% from a year earlier, but Nationwide predicts the market will slow in 2022.

title: Will travel return to normal this summer?
description: Travel bosses predict a bounce back for business this summer but challenges to recruit enough staff remain.

title: Moses J Moseley: 'Kind and wonderful' The Walking Dead actor dies at 31
description: Tributes are paid to "kind and wonderful" Moses J Moseley, who was a pet zombie on the horror show.

title: Curry scores 40 points as Warriors win sixth consecutive game
description: Stephen Curry scores 40 points as the Golden State Warriors beat the Houston Rockets 122-108 to win their sixth game in a row.

title: Fury v Whyte will be 'absolute madness'
description: Tyson Fury predicts he will knockout Dillian Whyte as fans react to heavyweight clash, plus Katie Taylor and Amanda Serrano set for blockbuster bout and more in this week's Fight Talk.

title: Winter Olympics: Matt Edmondson and Mollie King go head-to-head in skeleton challenge
description: BBC Radio 1 presenters Mollie King and Matt Edmondson go head-to-head in a skeleton challenge.

title: Free Spirits: Team GB snowsport athletes describe the perils of the job
description: Team GB's James Woods, Katie Ormerod, Kirsty Muir and Katie Summerhayes recount their list of injuries.

title: The Papers: 'Failure of leadership' and 'zero shame'
description: Sue Gray's update into her No 10 lockdown parties investigation dominates the newspaper headlines.

title: Whoopi Goldberg criticised for Holocaust remarks
description: The American TV personality later apologises after saying the Holocaust "was not about race".

title: Lawford: The village where the women are still in charge
description: In 1925, a newspaper article told how a village was "run by women". What is it like there today?

title: Boris Johnson visits Ukraine for talks as Russian invasion fears rise
description: The UK PM will hold talks designed to avert war, while Russia masses tens of thousands of troops.

title: Austria's Covid vaccine law comes into force amid resistance
description: The country is the first in Europe to make vaccination against Covid-19 mandatory for over-18s.

title: Earth has more tree species than we thought
description: There are more tree species than previously thought but mostly in fast disappearing forests.

title: Six transfer window talking points
description: Which Premier League club had the perfect winter window? And who has missed out? Phil McNulty has his say.

title: Wordle: New York Times buys popular word game
description: The New York Times says it bought the game from its creator for a price “in the low seven figures".

title: Measles warning for children as jab rate falls in England
description: MMR vaccine rates have fallen to their lowest level in a decade, data for England reveals.

title: Lyme disease: Man spent £25,000 before getting diagnosis
description: Steven Williams, 36, said his fit, active life was "totally devastated" by the struggle for answers.

title: Winter Olympics: James Woods & the 'internal battle' when counter culture meets elite sport
description: James Woods left home at 15 to follow his dream. Now he's an 'old man' of a rapidly changing sport, with one more shot at Olympic success.

title: Longleat welcomes first southern koala joey
description: The joey was born six months ago at Longleat safari park but has only recently started leaving its mother’s pouch.

title: Why cows may be hiding something but AI can spot it
description: Farmers are using artificial intelligence to spot lameness in their herd before it gets serious.
